intro: Calosacme amplectens, commonly known as the clinging bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers. The plant has a trailing growth habit and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs. Calosacme amplectens is often cultivated as a decorative plant in gardens due to its ornamental flowers and compact size.
